text.p: These are some of the leading stories in the official Iraqi press on Thursday. Reuters has not verified these stories and does not vouch for their accuracy.
- An Iraqi Irrigation Ministry official says cutting water flow in two major dams in the north is a criminal act.
- Legislative Council of the Kurdish Autonomous region condemns the cutting of water in the two dams.
- Turkish Energy Minister Recai Kutan arrives in Baghdad on Thursday to discuss oil and gas cooperation with Iraqi Oil Minister Amir Muhammad Rasheed.
- Polish firms to organise medical fair in Baghdad.
(The above were carried by THAWRA and QADISSIYA)
- A vessel loaded with wheat docks at Umm Qasr port in southern Iraq.
- President Saddam Hussein exchanges greetings on new Islamic year which starts on Thursday.
